original:
In general, shareholders in a corporation, limited partners in a limited partnership, and members of a limited liability company (LLC) enjoy protection from personal liability regarding the debts and obligations of the entity. Legally, these entities are treated as separate "persons," meaning that, barring any misconduct, the personal assets of the owners are safeguarded if the business fails.

sampled:
In general, shareholders in a corporation, limited partners in a limited partnership, and members within a limited liability association (LLC) enjoy protection from personal liability regarding the debts and obligations in the entity. Legally, these entities are treated as separate "persons," meaning that, barring any misconduct, the personal assets of the owners are safeguarded if the business fails.
